required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Meal Timings, Appetite, Mood and Weight Loss in Individuals on a Commercial Intermittent Fasting Programme
clinical_study.official_title: Observational Study to Assess Associations Between Daily Meal Timings, Appetite, Mood and Weight Loss in Individuals Completing a Commercial Intermittent Fasting Programme

brief_summary.textblock: Although individuals following commercial intermittent fasting programmes consume meal replacement products during fasting days, further behavioural variables such as time of food consumption, sleep quality and duration, appetite and mood may significantly impact weight loss and intervention success. This project aims to assess behavioural patterns (dietary intake, sleep, meal timing, physical activity), mood and appetite on both fasting and non-fasting days and to investigate whether these are associated with weight loss.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Change in body weight up to 12 weeks

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Before weight loss programme (day 0)
secondary_outcome.description: Pittsburg Sleep Quality Index (PSQI) questionnaire

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Before weight loss programme (day 0)
secondary_outcome.description: Pittsburg Sleep Quality Index (PSQI) questionnaire

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Before weight loss programme (day 0)
secondary_outcome.description: Simple Physical Activity Questionnaire (SIMPAQ)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Before weight loss programme (day 0)
secondary_outcome.description: Meal timings questionnaire

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Daily from day 1 up to 12 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Visual Analogue Scales, scale of 0 (I am not hungry at all) -100 (I have never been more hungry)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Daily from day 1 up to 12 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Visual Analogue Scales, scale of 0 (I am completely empty) -100 (I cannot eat another bite)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Daily from day 1 up to 12 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Visual Analogue Scales, scale of 0 (not at all) -100 (totally full)

secondary_outcome.measure: How much do you think you can eat?
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Daily from day 1 up to 12 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Visual Analogue Scales, scale of 0 (nothing at all) -100 (a lot)

secondary_outcome.measure: Would you like to eat something sweet?
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Daily from day 1 up to 12 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Visual Analogue Scales, scale of 0 (yes very much) -100 (not at all)

secondary_outcome.measure: Would you like to eat something salty?
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Daily from day 1 up to 12 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Visual Analogue Scales, scale of 0 (yes very much) -100 (not at all)

secondary_outcome.measure: Would you like to eat something savoury?
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Daily from day 1 up to 12 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Visual Analogue Scales, scale of 0 (yes very much) -100 (not at all)

secondary_outcome.measure: Would you like to eat something fatty?
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Daily from day 1 up to 12 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Visual Analogue Scales, scale of 0 (yes very much) -100 (not at all)

secondary_outcome.measure: Overall my mood is (very unpleasant to very pleasant)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Daily from day 1 up to 12 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Brief Mood Introspection Scale (BMIS), scale -10 to 10

secondary_outcome.measure: Mindfulness - I was finding to difficult to stay focused on what I was doing
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Weekly from week 1 up to 12 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Mindful Attention Awareness Scale (MASS), scale 0 (not at all) to 6 (very much)

secondary_outcome.measure: Mindfulness - I was doing something without paying attention
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Weekly from week 1 up to 12 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Mindful Attention Awareness Scale (MASS), scale 0 (not at all) to 6 (very much)

secondary_outcome.measure: Mindfulness - I was preoccupied with the future or the past
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Weekly from week 1 up to 12 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Mindful Attention Awareness Scale (MASS), scale 0 (not at all) to 6 (very much)

secondary_outcome.measure: Mindfulness - I was doing something automatically without being aware of what I was doing
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Weekly from week 1 up to 12 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Mindful Attention Awareness Scale (MASS), scale 0 (not at all) to 6 (very much)

secondary_outcome.measure: Mindfulness - I was rushing through something without really being attentive to it.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Weekly from week 1 up to 12 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Mindful Attention Awareness Scale (MASS), scale 0 (not at all) to 6 (very much)

intervention.description: Three "fasting" days a week, whereby participants consume 600-800 kcal/day from 4 meal replacement products: breakfast, lunch, a snack and dinner. During the other 4 non-fasting "smart" days each week, participants are instructed to consume 2 x 300 kcal meals and 2 x 100 kcal snacks, from a selection of recipes, plus one meal of their own choosing.

study_pop.textblock: Adults embarking on a commerical intermittent fasting weight loss programme

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Those responding to adverts on the LighterLife Fast Challenge social media channels will be asked if they would like to participate
Exclusion Criteria:
- Those without access to a smart phone or laptop will not be eligible to take part in the study due to the need to report variables daily

facility.name: Department of Nutritional Sciences, King's College London
